text: Mortal World's Torment & Power of Nature
Learn more about the Realm of Souls [[url:script_link_battle_realm_of_souls]]here[[/url]].
Amanar, slain and now re-animated, will strike against the enemies of its new master!
You have secured one of the Pieces of Eight, and may now command the [[sl:campaign_regiments_of_renown]]Regiment of Renown[[/sl]] bound to it.
Learn more about Pieces of Eight [[url:script_link_campaign_pieces_of_eight]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Pieces of Eight [[url:script_link_campaign_pieces_of_eight]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Lost Sea Shanty [[url:script_link_campaign_sea_shanties]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Lost Sea Shanty [[url:script_link_campaign_sea_shanties]]here[[/url]].
No treasure was found in the location you searched - try again elsewhere.
Sharing the loot with a pirate [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord after battle will temporarily improve their loyalty.
The loyalty of this [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord is cause for concern. Take steps to secure their obedience before they mutiny against your rule.
A pirate [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord has mutinied against your rule. Be sure to set an example and crush them!

A unit's [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership is a measure of how valiant and determined they are to continue fighting. For mortal units, if the [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level of a unit drops too low then the troops will rout from the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] and stop responding to orders. Note that immortal units, such as Daemons, will react differently to low leadership.
The leadership state of a unit is shown on its tooltip.

Siege weapons are large weapons of war constructed on-site. When ready, they are used to attack enemy fortifications during [[sl:battle_major_siege_battles]]major siege battles[[/sl]]. Use rams to breach settlement [[sl:battle_gates]]gates[[/sl]] and siege towers to get your troops on top of the enemy [[sl:battle_walls]]walls[[/sl]].

An attacker may capture a [[sl:battle_victory_locations]]victory location[[/sl]] in a [[sl:battle_major_siege_battles]]major siege battle[[/sl]] to begin earning [[sl_tooltip:battle_victory_tickets]]Victory Tickets[[/sl_tooltip]] over time.
Should the attacker earn enough Victory Tickets they will win the battle.
The defender may stop the attacker earning Victory Tickets by retaking any victory locations they hold.
1. Select some units by left-clicking and dragging a box around them.
2. Right-click and drag on the [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]] to order them into precise positions.
The Eye of Tzeentch [[url:script_link_battle_army_abilities]]army abilities[[/url]] become active if enough [[url:script_link_battle_spells]]spells[[/url]] are cast by Tzeentchian forces.
Learn more about the Eye of Tzeentch [[url:script_link_battle_eye_of_tzeentch]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the fire-at-will ability [[url:script_link_battle_fire_at_will]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about major siege battles [[url:script_link_battle_major_siege_battles]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about minor settlement battles [[url:script_link_battle_minor_settlement_battles]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about monsters and giants [[url:script_link_battle_monsters]]here[[/url]].
Plague Lord's Blessings [[url:script_link_battle_army_abilities]]army abilities[[/url]] become active when enough damage has been taken by Nurglish [[url:script_link_battle_units]]units[[/url]].
Learn more about the Plague Lord's Blessings [[url:script_link_battle_plague_lords_blessings]]here[[/url]].
Sensuous Seduction [[url:script_link_battle_army_abilities]]army abilities[[/url]] become active when the forces of Slaanesh make enough kills.
Learn more about the tactical map [[url:script_link_battle_tactical_map]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Winds of Magic [[url:script_link_battle_winds_of_magic]]here[[/url]].
Get overall help about battles in Total War here.
Learn about how to select and control your forces in battle.
Discover essential information about battlefields on which armies clash.
Find out about armies that contest battles here.
Learn about the units of warriors that fight for control of the battlefield.
Get informations about battles fought over settlements here.
Learn more about Master of the Elemental Winds [[url:script_link_battle_mastery_of_the_elemental_winds]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Storm of Magic Battles [[url:script_link_battle_storm_of_magic_battles]]here[[/url]].
Move the camera using the W, A, S and D keys.
Orientate the camera by holding down the middle mouse button.
Change the camera height with the mouse scroll wheel.
Hold down shift to move the camera faster.
Orders on the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] are issued to [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]], not individual troops.
Select a single unit by left-clicking.
Select multiple units by left-clicking and dragging a box around them.
Issue a move order to selected units by right-clicking on the [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]].
Double-right-click to order selected units to run.
Previous advice can be recalled with the [[sl_tooltip:battle_advice_history_buttons]]Advice Back buttons[[/sl_tooltip]].
Help pages are available to provide information while the game is running.
Issue an attack order to [[sl:battle_unit_selection]]selected units[[/sl]] by right-clicking an enemy.
Double-right-click on an enemy to order selected [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] to charge.
Soldiers fight best against enemies that are in front of them.
Units will suffer increased casualties when attacked from the sides or rear.
Double-click on a [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]unit card[[/sl]] to zoom to that [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]].
Select multiple units by clicking their unit cards while holding down Shift or CTRL.
Order selected [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] to precise positions by right-clicking and dragging out a formation on the [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]].
Hold the Spacebar to see unit destinations while they move.

A [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] will flee the [[sl:battle_battlefield]]battlefield[[/sl]] when its [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership level[[/sl]] drops too low, and no longer respond to orders.
A unit's [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level and the influencing factors are displayed on its tooltip.

Undead [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] will not flee the battle like living units, but will become unstable when their [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership level[[/sl]] drops.
Unstable units are less effective in combat and take even more damage.
Missile troops will automatically fire at any enemy [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] in range.
Hover the mouse cursor over a missile unit to display its arc of fire.
Right-click on a wall piece to order a selected [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] to climb it.

The [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord is the most important [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] in an [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] and provides a [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership[[/sl]] boost to nearby units.
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords can use powerful [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]abilities[[/sl]] to empower allied units and turn the tide of battle.
Mobile soldiers on mounts, ideal for swift manoeuvres.

A mounted charge can provoke a sudden drop in an enemy's [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership level[[/sl]], particularly when delivered to the [[sl:battle_flanking]]flank[[/sl]] or rear of a [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]].
Vulnerable against [[sl:battle_weapon_types]]spear weapons[[/sl]], and in prolonged engagements.
A battle is won when all [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] on one side are routed or killed.
A [[sl:battle_siege_battles]]siege battle[[/sl]] can also be won by capturing the central [[sl:battle_victory_points]]victory point[[/sl]].
[[sl:battle_wizards]]Wizards[[/sl]] can cast powerful spells in battle, either to aid allied troops or attack the enemy.
Available spells are shown on the [[sl:battle_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] panel when the wizard [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] is selected.
Casting spells depletes the available Winds of Magic, which recharges over time.
[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] with closely aligned goals may choose to form an alliance through [[sl:campaign_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/sl]].
Another faction wish to establish a [[img:icon_defensive_alliance]][[/img]]defensive alliance. {{tr:hp_campaign_alliances_add_02}}
Another faction wish to establish a [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]]military alliance. {{tr:hp_campaign_alliances_add_02}}
Learn more about armies at sea [[url:script_link_campaign_armies_at_sea]]here[[/url]].
A selected [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] can be ordered to attack an enemy army or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] by right-clicking on it.
Learn more about the Blessing of the Lady [[url:script_link_campaign_blessing_lady]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about The Great Game [[url:script_link_campaign_the_great_game]]here[[/url]].
Your character has gained a skill point to spend.
Corruption is high in territory you command  take steps to decrease it.

Corruption is a measure of [[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] or [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_vampires]]Vampiric[[/sl]] influence in a [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]], and is shown on the [[sl:campaign_province_info_panel]]Province Info panel[[/sl]]. Insufficient [[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]]Vampiric corruption in a province can lead to [[sl:campaign_public_order]]unrest[[/sl]] and [[img:icon_attrition]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_attrition]]attrition[[/sl]].
The influence of Undeath is low in territory you command  take steps to increase it.
[[img:icon_corruption_chs]][[/img]]Chaos corruption is high in territory you command  take steps to decrease it.
[[img:icon_corruption_vmp]][[/img]]Vampiric corruption is high in a territory you command  take steps to decrease it.
Some territory you command is [[img:icon_corruption_untainted]][[/img]]untainted by corruption  take steps to increase corruption here.
[[img:icon_corruption_skv]][[/img]]Skaven corruption is high in territory you command  take steps to decrease it.

[[sl:campaign_daemons_of_chaos]]Daemons of Chaos[[/sl]] unlock [[sl_tooltip:campaign_daemonic_gifts]]Daemonic Gifts[[/sl_tooltip]] as they earn [[sl:campaign_daemonic_glory]]Daemonic Glory[[/sl]] with the Ruinous Powers. {{tr:hp_campaign_daemonic_glory_add_02}}
Learn more about awakening Tomb Kings [[url:script_link_campaign_day_of_awakening]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Elven Council [[url:script_link_campaign_elven_council]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Exalted Greater Daemons [[url:script_link_campaign_exalted_greater_daemons]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about forging magic items [[url:script_link_campaign_forging_magic_items]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Gathering of the Ancients [[url:script_link_campaign_gathering_of_the_ancients]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Green Knight [[url:script_link_campaign_green_knight]]here[[/url]].

A [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus point has been generated in this province, and one of the settlements can be upgraded on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].
In-game help is available by pressing the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_help_pages_button]]Help Pages button[[/sl_tooltip]] in both campaign and battle.
Learn more about the Mortuary Cult [[url:script_link_campaign_mortuary_cult]]here[[/url]].
{{tr:hp_campaign_description_non_aggression_pacts}} Another faction wishes to establish a non-aggression pact with you.
Learn more about the Oak of Ages [[url:script_link_campaign_oak_of_ages]]here[[/url]].
Contracts may be browsed and accepted on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_contracts_panel]]Contracts panel[[/sl_tooltip]]. They may only be accepted on the turn that they are issued.
Learn more about the Ogre Kingdoms [[url:script_link_campaign_ogre_kingdoms]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about raising the dead [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_dead]]here[[/url]].

Factions in an [[img:icon_military_alliance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_alliance]]alliance[[/sl]] can spend the [[img:icon_allegiance]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_allegiance]]allegiance[[/sl]] built up between them to request direct control of an [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] belonging to the other.
Learn more about the War Co-ordination [[url:script_link_campaign_war_coordination]]here[[/url]].
A revolt has occurred in your territory - move swiftly to crush it!
Learn more about the Siege panel [[url:script_link_campaign_siege_panel]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Winds of Magic [[url:script_link_campaign_winds_of_magic]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the strategic map [[url:script_link_campaign_strategic_map]]here[[/url]].
[[sl:campaign_factions]]Factions[[/sl]] may wage war on one another in order to capture territory and achieve military dominance. Another faction is declaring war upon you.
Learn more about the Warriors of Chaos [[url:script_link_campaign_warriors_of_chaos]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Winds of Magic [[url:script_link_campaign_winds_of_magic]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Winds of Magic [[url:script_link_campaign_winds_of_magic]]here[[/url]].

Daemonic forces of [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] are sensitive to their [[sl_tooltip:campaign_winds_of_magic_power_reserve_bar]]power reserves[[/sl_tooltip]] of magic. High reserves grant beneficial effects in battle, while low levels  such as you currently experience  prevent [[img:icon_replenishment]][[/img]][[sl:campaign_unit_replenishment]]unit replenishment[[/sl]].
Learn more about the Winds of Magic [[url:script_link_campaign_winds_of_magic]]here[[/url]].
Low levels of the Winds of Magic in a province will deplete the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_winds_of_magic_power_reserve_bar]]power reserves[[/sl_tooltip]] of armies stationed there.
Learn more about the Winds of Magic [[url:script_link_campaign_winds_of_magic]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about zones of control [[url:script_link_campaign_zones_of_control]]here[[/url]].
Get overall help about the campaign game in Total War here.
The God-Bear of Kislev is held captive in the Realm of Chaos campaign.
The servants of the Ruinous Powers seek the complete annihilation of the mortal world.
Get information about the various humans, beasts and Daemons that populate the Warhammer world.
Factions is the umbrella term for the various tribes, kingdoms and empires that vie for supremacy.
Trade, alliances, and other agreements may be made between factions.
The territories of the world are divided into and managed by provinces.
Lords and Heroes are the commanders and champions that lead armies and wage war.
Learn about armies, the weapons through which factions defend their lands and crush their enemies.
When diplomacy fails, armies will clash in battle.
See also:\\n[[sl:campaign_unit_types]]Unit Types[[/sl]] | [[sl:campaign_raising_dead]]Raising Dead[[/sl]] | [[sl:campaign_regiments_of_renown]]Regiments of Renown[[/sl]]

The Empire can research [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]] from the [[sl:campaign_technology_panel]]Technology panel[[/sl]] once a [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]] that enables technology is constructed.
Move the camera with the W, A, S and D keys, or by holding the middle mouse button and dragging.
Zoom in and out by scrolling the mousewheel, or by using the Z and X keys.

Factions are tribes, peoples or nations on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] that control [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] and amass [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]].
A faction is destroyed when it controls no more armies or settlements.
The campaign map is the theatre in which [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] can be created, surveyed, commanded and destroyed.
Territory on the map is divided into [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]]. Each province contains multiple [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].

[[sl:campaign_buildings]]Buildings[[/sl]] within a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] can be browsed, constructed, repaired, and dismantled from the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].
A building's rollout panel is shown when the mouse cursor is placed over the building icon.
Building upgrades can be browsed and initiated from a building's rollout panel.
Time on the campaign map is advanced in [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]].

Use the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_end_turn_button]]End Turn button[[/sl_tooltip]] to move the game on. Other [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] will then get a turn to move their [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit units[[/sl]] and perform other actions.
Armies are used to attack and defend [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] and fight enemy armies.
An army is always led by a [[sl:campaign_lords]]Lord[[/sl]].
An army can be selected by left-clicking on it.
Selected armies can be moved to a location by right-clicking there.
[[sl:campaign_settlements]]Settlements[[/sl]] contain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] that provide a variety of benefits.
Settlements and buildings are managed from the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]], which appears when a settlement is selected.
The Province Overview panel shows all settlements within the selected [[sl:campaign_provinces]]province[[/sl]], as well as buildings within settlements under control.

Additional [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] can be recruited into a selected [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] from the [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment_panel]]Recruitment panel[[/sl]], which is opened from the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]].
Left-click on a [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]unit card[[/sl]] on the Recruitment panel to add it to the recruitment queue.
The cost of recruiting each unit is shown on its unit card and is subtracted from the {{tr:icon_treasury}}[[sl_tooltip:campaign_treasury]]treasury[[/sl_tooltip]].
Researching new technologies can bring a variety of military and civic benefits.
Only one technology may be researched at a time.
Research is undertaken on the [[sl:campaign_technology_panel]]Technology panel[[/sl]].

Greenskin factions can research [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]] from the [[sl:campaign_technology_panel]]Technology panel[[/sl]] once a Goblin Workshop [[sl:campaign_buildings]]building[[/sl]] is constructed.
Gain control of Norscan Tribes through the language of battle.
Killing Norscan faction leaders in battle will force their faction to confederate .
Gifts for those that pledge allegiance to one of the Norscan gods.
Learn more about Allegiance to the Gods [[url:script_link_campaign_gods]]here[[/url]].
Allegiance can be pledged when razing settlements.
Lost when swaying from one god to support another.
Grants faction wide buffs for pledging allegiance.
Locks chosen god for the end of the game to receive an ultimate reward.
Used to call the Gods' Challengers endgame.
A book of the most savage and horrifying creatures in the world.
Learn more about the Monstrous Arcanum [[url:script_link_campaign_monsters]]here[[/url]].
Activate hunts through the Monstrous Arcanum.
Hunt monsters whereabouts before fighting them in battle.
Gain powerful rewards for defeating them.
Recruit some of these monsters as Regiments of Renown to your armies once defeated.
Orders in battle are issued to units, not individual troops.
Hills and other terrain features can obscure visibility, allowing units to hide from their enemys line of sight.
Each army is led by a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord, who leads and encourages the troops in battle.
The [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord appears in battle as a single-person unit.
[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords provide a [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership[[/sl]] boost to nearby troops, improving their courage in battle.
The area of a [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord's [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership boost is shown as a blue circle when the cursor is placed over them.
Select multiple units by left-clicking and dragging a box around them.
Units may also be selected by left-clicking their [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]Unit cards[[/sl]].
Hold CTRL while clicking to add units to the current selection.
Press CTRL + A to select all units
Issue a move order to selected [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] by right-clicking on the [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]].
Hold the Spacebar to see [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] destinations when moving.
Right-click and drag on the [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]] to order selected units into precise positions.
Press Backspace to halt selected units.
Issue an attack order to selected [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] by right-clicking an enemy.
Place the mouse cursor over a [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] or [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]Unit card[[/sl]] to show information about that unit on its tooltip.
The remaining [[img:icon_hp]][[/img]]health of a unit is indicated on a unit's tooltip or Unit card.
A unit's [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level is a measure of its will to continue fighting, and will drop as it takes casualties.
A unit will flee the battlefield when its [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level drops too low, and will no longer respond to orders.
Any factors influencing a unit's [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership level are shown on its tooltip.
Units with the high ground enjoy a significant advantage when fighting on sloped terrain.
Missile units are generally lightly-armoured and weak in hand-to-hand combat.
An arc of fire is displayed when the cursor is placed over a [[sl:battle_missile_units]]missile unit[[/sl]].
Missile units will automatically fire at enemies within their arc of fire, unless instructed otherwise.

A [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] will suffer a penalty to its [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership level[[/sl]], and may suffer increased casualties, when attacked in the [[sl:battle_flanking]]sides or the rear[[/sl]].
Arranging troops in a line will minimise opportunities for enemies to surround them.
Missile troops are best kept out of hand-to-hand fighting.
Select your [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord in order to be able to browse and activate his [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]abilities[[/sl]].
A selected unit's abilities are shown around the [[sl:battle_unit_portrait_panel]]Unit Portrait panel[[/sl]].
Mounted troops ride into battle on mounts, making them ideal for swift manoeuvres.

A mounted charge can provoke a sudden drop in an enemy's [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership level[[/sl]], particularly when delivered to the [[sl:battle_flanking]]flank or rear[[/sl]] of a unit.
Mounted units are vulnerable against [[sl:battle_weapon_types]]spear weapons[[/sl]], and in prolonged engagements.
Soldiers fight best against enemies that are in front of them.
A unit will suffer a penalty to its [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership level[[/sl]], and may suffer increased casualties, when attacked in the sides or the rear.
Move with the W, A, S and D keys.
Drag the middle mouse-button to change facing.
Change height by scrolling the middle mouse-button.
[[sl:battle_units]]Units[[/sl]] may be arranged for the coming fight during the deployment phase of the [[sl:battle_battle_game]]battle[[/sl]]. Once deployment is completed the battle begins.
Units may be positioned within the designated deployment zone.
A battle will automatically be won by the defender if the time limit expires.
The attacker must attack and defeat the defender within the time limit to achieve victory.
Most [[sl:battle_unit_types]]troop-types[[/sl]] can be hidden in forests.
Each unit's [[sl:battle_visibility]]visibility[[/sl]] status is indicated on its [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]Unit card[[/sl]].

Each [[sl:battle_units]]unit[[/sl]] in the players [[sl:battle_armies]]army[[/sl]] is represented on the [[sl:battle_battle_interface]]battle interface[[/sl]] by a Unit card. These are shown on the [[sl:battle_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]].
Information about the status of a unit is shown on its Unit card.
Double-left-click on a Unit card to zoom the camera to the associated unit.
[[sl:battle_infantry]]Infantry[[/sl]] are best arranged in a wide battle line to engage and pin the main body of the enemy.
[[sl:battle_missile_units]]Missile troops[[/sl]] are best used to harass and weaken the enemy prior to engagement.
[[sl:battle_mounted_units]]Mounted troops[[/sl]] are mostly used to [[sl:battle_flanking]]attack the sides and rear[[/sl]] of the enemy once fighting has commenced.
Learn more about Vows and Troths [[url:script_link_campaign_bretonnian_vows]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Possession & Tz'arkan's Whispers [[url:script_link_campaign_dark_elves_possession_tzarkan]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the defence of Ulthuan [[url:script_link_campaign_defender_of_ulthuan]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Emperor's Mandate [[url:script_link_campaign_emperors_mandate]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Imperial Authority & Prestige [[url:script_link_campaign_imperial_authority]]here[[/url]].
A [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] is destroyed when it controls no more [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].
Learn more about the Geomantic Web [[url:script_link_campaign_geomantic_web]]here[[/url]].

A [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]]population surplus point has been generated in this province. Earn more to be able to upgrade the main settlement building on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview panel[[/sl]].
Learn more about Intrigue at the Court [[url:script_link_campaign_intrigue_at_the_court]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Defence of the Great Plan [[url:script_link_campaign_defence_great_plan]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Jungle Nexus [[url:script_link_campaign_jungle_nexus]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Sacrifices to Sotek [[url:script_link_campaign_sacrifice_to_sotek]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about Marked for Death [[url:script_link_campaign_marked_for_death]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Menace Below [[url:script_link_campaign_the_menace_below]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Mortal World's Torment [[url:script_link_campaign_mortal_worlds_torment]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Power of Nature [[url:script_link_campaign_power_of_nature]]here[[/url]].
High Elves collect [[img:ui/skins/wh2_main_high_elves/icon_ritual_currency.png]][[/img]]Way-fragments in order to conduct rituals.
Dark Elves collect [[img:ui/skins/warhammer2/icon_ritual_currency.png]][[/img]]the Scrolls of Hekarti in order to conduct rituals.
Lizardmen collect [[img:ui/skins/wh2_main_lizardmen/icon_ritual_currency.png]][[/img]]ancient plaques in order to conduct rituals.
Skaven collect [[img:ui/skins/wh2_main_skaven/icon_ritual_currency.png]][[/img]]Warpstone in order to conduct rituals.
Learn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]]here[[/url]].

Clan Skryre are known for their diabolical technological experiments, carried out in workshops beneath Skavenblight. The Forbidden Workshop is where Ikit Claw conducts his own personal experiments, upgrading Skryres Weapons Teams, Doomwheels and Doom-Flayers, and assembling [[img:icon_doomrocket]][[/img]]Doomrockets so powerful they can devastate enemy armies with their lethal strength.\\n\\nThe Forbidden Workshop can be accessed from the main campaign interface when playing as the Clan Skryre faction.
Learn more about the Forbidden Workshop [[url:script_link_campaign_forbidden_workshop]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Skaven Under-Empire [[url:script_link_campaign_skaven_underworld]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Sword of Khaine [[url:script_link_campaign_sword_of_khaine]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Sword of Khaine [[url:script_link_campaign_sword_of_khaine]]here[[/url]].
Some [[sl:campaign_races]]races[[/sl]] must construct certain [[sl:campaign_buildings]]buildings[[/sl]] before they can research [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]].

The campaign map is the main [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]game[[/sl]] theatre, in which [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] are created, commanded and destroyed.
Territory on the map is divided into [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]]. Each province contains multiple [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].
Armies are used to attack and defend [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]], and fight enemy armies.
An army can be selected by left-clicking on it.

The distance a selected [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] or [[sl:campaign_heroes]]hero[[/sl]] can move in a [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]] is displayed on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]].
A selected army may be moved to a location by right-clicking there.
[[sl:campaign_armies]]Armies[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] exert zones of control around them.
Enemies cannot pass through a zone of control, except to attack the owner.

Additional [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] can be recruited into a selected [[sl:campaign_armies]]army[[/sl]] from the [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment_panel]]Recruitment panel[[/sl]], which is opened from the [[sl:campaign_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]].
Left-click on a [[sl:campaign_unit_cards]]Unit card[[/sl]] on the [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment_panel]]Recruitment panel[[/sl]] to add it to the recruitment queue.
The cost of recruiting each unit is shown on its unit card and is subtracted from the [[sl:campaign_treasury]]treasury[[/sl]].
Territory on the map is divided into [[sl:campaign_provinces]]provinces[[/sl]]. Each province contains multiple [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]].
Information about a province may be viewed by selecting any of the settlements in the province.
Buildings and construction options within controlled [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlements[[/sl]] are shown on the [[sl:campaign_province_overview_panel]]Province Overview Panel[[/sl]].
A building may be upgraded, repaired or dismantled from the rollout panel that appears when the mouse cursor is placed over its building icon.
Building construction is completed over multiple [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]].
Researching new technologies can bring a variety of military and civic benefits.
Research is undertaken on the [[sl:campaign_technology_panel]]Technology panel[[/sl]].
Only one technology may be researched at a time.
Time on the [[sl:campaign_campaign_map]]campaign map[[/sl]] is advanced in turns.

Use the [[sl:campaign_end_turn_button]]End Turn button[[/sl]] to move the game on. Other [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] will then get a turn to move their [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]], [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruit units[[/sl]], and perform other actions.
Learn more about Athel Tamarha and the Mists of Yvresse [[url:script_link_campaign_athel_tamarha]]here[[/url]].
Learn more about the Forge of Daith [[url:script_link_campaign_forge_of_daith]]here[[/url]].
The Visions of the Old Ones Map
When viewing the Visions of the Old Ones map, selecting any map marker will reveal information about the mission or destination.
Scrolling the mousewheel allows you to zoom in and out, while left-clicking and dragging will allow you to move around the map.
Learn more about Visions of the Old Ones [[img:bullet_lzd_threat_map]][[/img]][[url:script_link_campaign_oxyotl_visions]]here[[/url]].
Visions of the Old Ones Missions
All Visions of the Old Ones missions have a time limit, offering rewards for success but also consequences if not completed in time.
Learn more about Visions of the Old Ones [[img:bullet_lzd_threat_map]][[/img]][[url:script_link_campaign_oxyotl_visions]]here[[/url]].
Travelling to Visions of The Old Ones
Only Oxyotl and his army can use the Visions of the Old Ones map to travel, and only once per turn.
Oxyotl cannot travel while in enemy territory, to or from the sea, or while involved in a siege.
Oxyotl can also travel to his capital region and to the Silent Sanctum in which a Capstone of Tepok is built.
Learn more about Visions of the Old Ones [[img:bullet_lzd_threat_map]][[/img]][[url:script_link_campaign_oxyotl_visions]]here[[/url]].
Blood for the Blood God [[sl:battle_army_abilities]]army abilities[[/sl]] become active when enough kills are made by anyone in battle.
Learn more about Blood for the Blood God [[sl:battle_blood_for_the_blood_god]]here[[/sl]].

The campaign map is the main [[sl:campaign_campaign_game]]game[[/sl]] theatre, on which [[sl:campaign_armies]]armies[[/sl]] and [[sl:campaign_factions]]factions[[/sl]] are created, commanded and destroyed.
Building construction is completed over multiple [[sl:campaign_turns]]turns[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_prologue_help_pages]][[/img]]Left-click on the Information button to learn more about a panel.\\n\\n[[img:icon_prologue_objective_button]][[/img]] To locate your missions, left-click on the Objectives button adjacent to the End Turn button. \\n\\nTo successfully complete The Lost God, you must satisfy your victory conditions, which can be found with your missions.\\n\\n

[[img:icon_prologue_treasury]][[/img]]This shows the immediate cost or gain to your treasury and [[img:icon_income_prologue]][[/img]] the cost per turn or income per turn.\\n\\nRecruiting a unit incurs both an immediate cost and an upkeep cost paid each turn.\\n\\nBuild and upgrade Store Houses to increase your predicted income.

Population surplus [[img:icon_pop_surplus]][[/img]] is required in order to upgrade settlements, which is increased with growth[[img:icon_growth]][[/img]]. The Fire Pit and the Dazh Shrine both generate growth.\\n\\n[[img:icon_prologue_technology]][[/img]]To research a technology beneficial to your faction, left-click on the Technology button adjacent to the End Turn button.\\n\\n[[img:icon_prologue_stances]][[/img]]Changing a Lords stance on the campaign map affects their abilities. Find the stances available next to their portrait. An enemy Lords current stance appears above them on the campaign map. Note that the adoption of certain stances prevent a battle from taking place.\\n\\n[[img:icon_prologue_diplomacy]][[/img]]Diplomacy can be used to gain allies, demand payment, or declare war, among other things. To engage with other factions, left-click on the Diplomacy button adjacent to the End Turn button.

Gaining experience through actions on the battlefield accrues skill points.\\n\\n[[img:icon_prologue_skills]][[/img]]To open a character's skill tree, select one and press the Rank button. Skills enable you to both gain abilities and improve effects and statistics. \\n\\n[[img:icon_prologue_character]][[/img]]New items can be equipped via a character's inventory, viewed by selecting them and left-clicking on the Character Details button.\\n\\n[[img:icon_prologue_recruit_lord]][[/img]]A Legendary Lord, such as Prince Yuri, cannot truly die, so if they are killed you can recruit them again in any settlement which you own.\\n\\nWhen embedded within an army, Heroes can fight on the battlefield alongside its troops and commanding Lord. To embed a Frost Maiden Hero, select her and then right-click on a friendly army.\\n\\nTo fight a quest battle, find its marker on the campaign map. With Prince Yuri selected, right-click on the marker to attack it. Note that he must have sufficient movement points to reach the marker for this to occur.
These enemies have shields which you will have to get through before being able to cause damage to them.
A battle will automatically be won by the defender if the time limit expires.
The attacker must attack and defeat the defender within the time limit to achieve victory.
[[sl:battle_units]]Units[[/sl]] may be deployed by selecting them and right-clicking a target position.
Units reposition instantly during the deployment phase.
Click the button below to launch a tour about the fundamentals of [[sl:battle_battle_game]]battle[[/sl]].
Launching this tour will end [[sl:battle_deployment]]deployment phase[[/sl]].
Battles are fought between [[sl:battle_armies]]armies[[/sl]] to conquer or defend territory. Battles are won by killing or routing all enemy units.
Troops in battle are grouped into [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]]. {{tr:hp_battle_point_1_armies}}
Move with the W, A, S and D keys.
Drag the middle mouse-button to change facing.
Change height by scrolling the middle mouse-button.
Units are selected by left-clicking on them.
Units may also be selected by left-clicking their [[sl:battle_unit_cards]]Unit cards[[/sl]] on the [[sl:battle_army_panel]]Army panel[[/sl]].
Left-click on the [[sl:battle_terrain]]terrain[[/sl]] to clear the current selection.
CTRL+A can be pressed to select all [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]].
Press Backspace to halt selected units.
Battles may be paused and unpaused by pressing P.
[[sl:battle_unit_movement]]Unit movement[[/sl]] orders may be issued while the game is paused.
Issue attack orders to individual units to have them attack different enemies.
Try to surround the enemy as you attack, and avoid them surrounding you.
Arrange [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] in a battle line facing the enemy to help prevent them from being flanked.
Each unit in a line of battle covers the flank of the next.
Routing units may rally when out of danger, becoming controllable again.
Units that are shattered can never rally.
This is a destination node. If your Caravan arrives there, you will receive the reward beside it. Click this node to plot its route there.

Now chart the route your Caravan should take. You can alter the route even after it has been dispatched and so react to perils along the way. It will move after ending your [[sl:campaign_turns]]turn[[/sl]].
All Caravans start here. The lines leaving this point represent the different routes a Caravan can take. As the game progresses, dangers will be displayed beside these lines.
[[sl:campaign_changing_of_the_ways]]Changing of the Ways[[/sl]] actions cost [[sl:campaign_grimoires]]Grimoires[[/sl]] to perform.
Actions that can be performed are shown on the [[sl_tooltip:campaign_changing_of_the_ways_panel]]Changing of the Ways panel[[/sl_tooltip]].
Most actions must be unlocked by researching [[sl:campaign_technology]]technologies[[/sl]] to become available.

The Transfer Settlement action is available immediately, which can be used to take possession of a [[sl:campaign_settlements]]settlement[[/sl]] controlled by a [[sl:campaign_factions]]faction[[/sl]] you're not at war with.
Once this tour is completed, click this button followed by the settlement you wish to transfer.
Click this button to equip [[sl_tooltip:campaign_daemonic_gifts]]Daemonic Gift[[/sl_tooltip]] body parts.

The [[sl_tooltip:campaign_daemonic_gifts]]Daemonic Gifts[[/sl_tooltip]] equipped by the [[sl:campaign_daemons_of_chaos]]Daemon Prince[[/sl]] [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord are shown here. Click a slot to change the body part you have equipped. If there are alternative body parts available, you can click to equip them.

This is the Daemonic Glory panel. It shows the [[sl:campaign_daemonic_glory]]Daemonic Glory[[/sl]] you have accrued with each [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] God, as well as the associated [[sl_tooltip:campaign_daemonic_gifts]]Daemonic Gift[[/sl_tooltip]] rewards. These can be equipped to your [[sl:campaign_daemons_of_chaos]]Daemon Prince[[/sl]] [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord.
Each tracker fills when you accrue [[sl:campaign_daemonic_glory]]Daemonic Glory[[/sl]] for the associated [[sl:campaign_chaos]]Chaos[[/sl]] God.

[[sl_tooltip:campaign_daemonic_gifts]]Daemonic Gifts[[/sl_tooltip]], including [[sl:campaign_units]]units[[/sl]] for [[sl:campaign_unit_recruitment]]recruitment[[/sl]] and Daemonic body parts, will be unlocked as milestones are reached.
Place the mouse cursor over a Chaos God's icon to see where Daemonic Glory was gained.

After [[sl_tooltip:campaign_daemonic_gifts]]Daemonic Gift[[/sl_tooltip]] body parts are unlocked, they can be equipped to your [[sl:campaign_daemons_of_chaos]]Daemon Prince[[/sl]] [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord to gain powerful effects.
As the attacker, you will lose the battle if the time limit expires.
As the defender, you will win the battle if the time limit expires.
As the attacker, you must deploy first, and cannot see the enemy forces during deployment.
As the defender you deploy second, and can see the attacker's forces during deployment, [[sl:battle_visibility]]terrain permitting[[/sl]].
Both the attacker and defender may conceal [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] in foliage during deployment, if it is available.
Vanguard units may be positioned outside of the deployment area.
The flag of the defender will be lowered and the flag of the attacker will be raised while the capture is taking place.
The defender may re-capture a location after losing it, using the same method.
The loss of a supply location to the attacker means the loss of these [[img:icon_supplies]][[/img]]Supplies.
Click below to launch a tour about [[sl:battle_unit_types]]unit types[[/sl]].

[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]heroes appear as single-person [[sl:battle_units]]units[[/sl]] in battle. Hand-to-hand specialists are a formidable presence in any battle line, while those that wield the [[sl:battle_winds_of_magic]]Winds of Magic[[/sl]] can cast powerful offensive and defensive [[sl:battle_spells]]spells[[/sl]] from afar.

[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]heroes commonly have [[sl:battle_unit_abilities]]unit abilities[[/sl]] that provide combat bonuses to the character or their allies, or penalties to the enemy.

[[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords and [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]heroes provide a [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]][[sl:battle_leadership]]leadership[[/sl]] boost to nearby troops. The area of this effect is shown as a blue circle around the unit when the cursor is placed over them.
